description.p: Brisk is a high-speed desktop download manager designed for efficiency and integration with the browser

ul.li: Downloading video streams from the browser
Soft-subbing video files downloaded from streaming websites
Advanced rules to automatically define file save path based on custom patterns
Customizable Hotkey for adding a URL from clipboard

description.p: A new option is now available: rhttp, a Rust-based HTTP client to boost download performance compared to the default Dart HTTP client. Since rhttp uses FFI, it requires additional system resources, as it spawns extra threads to allow for communication between the Rust layer and the Dart app. You can enable this client via: Settings ‚Üí Connection ‚Üí Download Engine ‚Üí HTTP Client Type ‚Üí Performance (Experimental) Because this feature is still new, it remains opt-in and is not enabled by default. The default client remains the Dart-based HTTP client due to its proven stability and compatibility with the download engine.
